Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lactoferrampin (LFampin 268â€“284, LFampinB, predicted AMPs, bovine lactoferrin bLF N1 domain residues 268-284, Lys-rich, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: identified based on typical features of AMPs.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 44.44% similar toEumenine mastoparan-AF. K: 29%, L=S: 12%.Activity: Active against Gram- E. coli O157:H7 or K12 (MIC 5.8-25 uM), P. aeruginosa Pak (MIC 7 uM), A.naeslundii (MIC >100 uM), P.gingivalis HG 66 (MIC>100 uM),  Gram+ B. subtilis ATCC 9372 (MIC 18 uM), S.sanguis SK4 (MIC >100 uM), S.mutans (MIC >100 uM), and yeast C. albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC 2.1 uM).MOA:fungi:C. albicans: acted on membranes.In vitro toxicity: human RBC: only hemolytic at high concentration close to 100 uM.Structure: 3D structures of the peptide in complex with SDS or DPC have been determined by 2D NMR. Helical for the N-terminal 11 residues but disordered for the C-terminal region. The C-terminal charged region is proposed to initiate binding followed by helix formation at the N-terminus (Haney et al., 2007).
Literature Information.Author: van der Kraan MI, Groenink J, Nazmi K, Veerman EC, Bolscher JG, Nieuw Amerongen AV.2004
Literature Information.Title: Lactoferrampin: a novel antimicrobial peptide in the N1-domain of bovine lactoferrin.
